dt: {bc}a building or chamber in which bodies or bones are deposited

et: Middle English, from Anglo-French {it}carnel, charnel{/it}, probably alteration of {it}charner{/it}, from Medieval Latin {it}carnarium{/it}, from Latin {it}carn-, caro{/it} flesh {ma}{mat|carnal|}{/ma}
shortdef: a building or chamber in which bodies or bones are deposited —called also charnel house
